intro: Spiesia fetida, commonly known as the stinkplant, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and aromatic leaves. The plant is known for its strong, unpleasant odor, which is most noticeable when the leaves are crushed. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments and can be found in forests and along stream banks. Spiesia fetida is often used in traditional medicine, though its use is limited due to its pungent properties.
